root_causes: Entry condition not implemented: script does not restrict to qCountry = 7.
Test-mode logic inverted: expected to SHOW only in test mode, but script excludes test respondents using (qTesting <> 1).
Selection uses HidS4DE_chk rather than the expected variable HidS4DE (inconsistent with Variable ID).
Special codes (e.g., 97/98/99) are not handled explicitly â€” the 'else if not miss(S4)' maps all non-missing S4 to code 2, which may misclassify special responses.
instructions: Enforce the expected entry conditions: restrict the selection to records where qCountry = 7 AND test mode is true. If your environment uses qTesting, require qTesting = 1; if an isTest() function is available, use isTest(). Example: sel if ( ( miss(HidS4DE) or HidS4DE ne HidS4DE_expected ) and qCountry = 7 and qTesting = 1 ).
Reverse the current exclusion: replace 'and ( qTesting <> 1 )' with 'and qTesting = 1' (or use isTest()) so only test respondents are shown.

Use the expected variable name HidS4DE for comparisons/listing unless HidS4DE_chk is intentionally the real survey variable. If HidS4DE is the Variable ID, change HidS4DE_chk to HidS4DE throughout or document why a different variable is used.

Handle special codes explicitly so they are not mis-mapped. For example, set HidS4DE_expected = $sysmis for any(S4,97,98,99) (and any other survey-specific special codes), then map remaining valid S4 codes to 1 or 2. Example logic: if any(S4,3,4,...,71) HidS4DE_expected=1. else if any(S4,97,98,99) HidS4DE_expected=$sysmis. else if not miss(S4) HidS4DE_expected=2.
Verify the S4 code list used for mapping matches the questionnaire specification. If any S4 codes should map differently, adjust the 'any(S4,...)' lists accordingly.
